Class Sorting

java.lang.Object
algorithm.sorting.Sorting
public class Sorting extends Object
This class contains various sorting algorithms

    static void
    countingsort(int[] A)
    Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in Θ(n+k)

    heapsort(T[] A)
    Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in O(n log n) using the heapsort algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • selectionsort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void selectionsort(T[] A)
      Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in Θ(n2)

      Implements the selectionsort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average/Best-case cost: Θ(n2)
      Type Parameters:
      T - class of the object in the array
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • selectionsort

      public static void selectionsort(int[] A)
      Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in Θ(n2)

      Implements the selectionsort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average/Best-case cost: Θ(n2)
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • insertionsort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void insertionsort(T[] A)
      Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in O(n2)

      Implements the insertionsort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average-case cost: Θ(n2)
      • Best-case cost: Θ(n)
      Type Parameters:
      T - class of the object in the array
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • insertionsort

      public static void insertionsort(int[] A)
      Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in O(n2)

      Implements the insertionsort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average-case cost: Θ(n2)
      • Best-case cost: Θ(n)
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • mergesort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void mergesort(T[] A)
      Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in Θ(nlogn)

      Implements the mergesort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average/Best-case cost: Θ(nlogn)
      Type Parameters:
      T - class of the object in the array
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • mergesort

      public static void mergesort(int[] A)
      Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in Θ(nlogn)

      Implements the mergesort algorithm.

      • Worst/Average/Best-case cost: Θ(nlogn)
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • quicksort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void quicksort(T[] A)
      Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in O(n2) and O(nlogn) on the average

      Implements the quicksort algorithm.

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(n2)
      • Average/Best-case cost: Θ(nlogn)
      Type Parameters:
      T - class of the object in the array
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • quicksort

      public static void quicksort(int[] A)
      Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in O(n2) and O(nlogn) on the average

      Implements the quicksort algorithm.

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(n2)
      • Average/Best-case cost: Θ(nlogn)
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • countingsort

      public static void countingsort(int[] A)
      Sorts the specified array into ascending numerical order in Θ(n+k)

      Implements the countingsort algrithm.

      • Worst/Average/Best-case cost: Θ(n+k), where k = max(A)-min(A)+1
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted

    • heapsort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void heapsort(T[] A)
      Sorts the specified array according to the ordering induced by the compareTo() method in O(n log n) using the heapsort algorithm.
      • Worst-case: Θ(n log n)
      • Best-case: Θ(n)
      Type Parameters:
      T - class of the object in the array
      Parameters:
      A - the array to be sorted
